text:
Synopsis:

When running Tomcat as an embedded server via the EmbeddedTomcat class.
There is an operation 'setDebug' which when used to set debug to any value > 0
causes null pointer exceptions to be thrown when trying to access JSPs etc.

Cause:

In the SessionInterceptor class in the beforeBody operation is the following
line:

if( debug>0 ) cm.log("Before Body " + reqSessionId );

However when instantiated via the EmbeddedTomcat class the ContextManager (cm)
has not been set so a null pointer exception is generated whenever debug > 0.

I'm not sure whether the solution is to check if cm is non null or whether
this should have been set when the interceptor was instantiated?
creator: steve@prismtechnologies.com
cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Can you check this against 3.3 ? If it's still there, we can fix it, but 
for 3.2 I don't think it's important enough.
